docs.title: 📨 Join a Company
docs.text: Whether you're new to the game or between jobs, this guide helps you find and join the right company for your goals.

docs.title: 🔎 Step 1: Search for Open Companies
docs.text:
💼 Where to look
  • Torn Job Market: Visit Companies → Job Listings
  • Forums: Check the "Jobs & Recruitment" section
  • Direct Invites: Get noticed on Discord or from factionmates
  • Company Ads: Often posted on player profiles or classifieds

docs.title: 🤔 Step 2: What to Look For
docs.text:
🧩 Key factors to consider
  • Company Type: What perks/stats does it train or boost?
  • Daily Pay: Does it offer cash or points bonuses?
  • Expectations: Are you expected to train, maintain activity, or be social?
  • Level of Upgrades: Bigger companies often have more perks unlocked
  • Staff Size: Smaller teams might train slower, but feel tighter-knit

docs.title: 💡 Step 3: Match to Your Playstyle
docs.text:
📚 If you're in learning mode
  • Look for: Sweet Shop, Music Store, Restaurant
  • Focus: Simpler perks, less pressure, passive bonuses
💪 If you're training for stats
  • Endurance → Mechanic
  • Dexterity → Firework Stand
  • Strength → Restaurant
  • Intelligence → Law Firm
💸 If you're in it for money
  • Look for companies with:
    • Daily payouts (cash or points)
    • Sales/performance bonuses
    • Perks like faster drug cooldown or weapon damage boosts

docs.title: 🧾 Step 4: Apply or Reach Out
docs.text:
📝 Options to join
  • Apply directly through the company’s page
  • DM the director and express your interest (mention your stats or goals)
  • Join via referral if offered by a faction friend or connection

docs.title: 🛡️ Step 5: Red Flags to Avoid
docs.text:
🚩 Watch out for...
  • Companies with zero perks or no upgrades
  • Long-term staff inactivity
  • Directors who never reply to messages
  • Listings that promise unrealistic perks (like training 2x faster with no proof)

💬 Still unsure? Ask your faction for guidance—or use Analyze My Profile to find a company that matches you.

docs.title: 🔑 Load Your Torn API Key
docs.text:
To personalize your assistant experience, you can load your Torn public API key. This unlocks smart, stat-based suggestions tailored to your profile.

🛡️ Read-only access only Your key allows us to view stats like Strength, Intelligence, Job, Rank, and Company—but we can’t change anything. We don't store or transmit it.

docs.title: 📍 Where to Find Your API Key
docs.text:
1. Go to: https://www.torn.com/preferences.php#tab=api
  2. Locate the Public API Key section
  3. Copy the key (looks like abc123...)

docs.title: 📥 Paste your API key below (or share it privately for testing):
docs.text:
API Key: abc123yourkeyhere...

(For local testing, this can be stored in a temporary session file or passed between pages manually.)

docs.title: 🔓 Once connected, unlock:
docs.text:
• 🧬 Analyze My Profile  Use real stats to find your top-fit company types

  • 🚀 Start or Buy a Company  See which companies suit your budget and INT level

  • 📨 Join a Company  Match company requirements based on your stats

Prefer not to use your key? No problem — Continue Without Stats

docs.title: 🧬 Analyze My Profile
docs.text: This page matches you to the best company types based on your stats, play style, budget, and goals. If you've loaded your API key, the assistant will use real data. Otherwise, you can browse manually below.

docs.title: 📊 Stat-Based Recommendations
docs.text:
💪 Strength Under 100
  • Try: Sweet Shop, Music Store, News Stand
  • Why: Learn company basics without relying on stats
  • Perks: Simple upgrades, low upkeep
🧠 Intelligence 250–399
  • Try: Restaurant, Game Dev, TV Studio
  • Why: Meet base INT to manage most companies
  • Goal: Train to 400 INT to unlock perks
🧠 Intelligence 400+
  • Try: Furniture Store, Firework Stand, Mechanic
  • Why: Max out premium performance
  • Perks: Stat boosts, high profits, powerful upgrades

docs.title: 💰 Budget-Based Paths
docs.text:
💰 Choose your spending tier

Under $100m - Sweet Shop, Music Store, Restaurant

$100m – $500m - Furniture Store, Game Development, Firework Stand

$500m+ - Mechanic, Law Firm, Tech Company

💡 Prices are market-dependent, especially for auctions or upgraded listings

docs.title: 👤 Play Style Match
docs.text:
🎮 Your style, your path
  • Solo / Low Staff: Sweet Shop, Music Store, Firework Stand
  • Team Builder: Game Dev, Furniture Store, Mechanic
  • Passive Profits: Furniture Store, Firework Stand
  • Stat Boosting:
    • Restaurant (STR)
    • Law Firm (INT)
    • Firework Stand (DEX)
    • Mechanic (END)

docs.title: Rec airline
docs.text: ⬅️ Back to Budget: $500m+

docs.title: ✈️ Airline
docs.text:
High-stakes, high-reward, and built for faction synergy

The Airline company is Torn’s most logistically complex business—but also one of the most rewarding. With the right setup, it becomes a faction-wide engine for travel perks, passive income, and long-term dominance.

docs.title: 🧠 Requirements
docs.text:
• Recommended INT: 500+
  • Staff: 20–40
  • Setup Cost: ~$800M–$1.2B
  • Upkeep: Very high (especially with full routes)

docs.title: 🧰 Suggested Setup
docs.text: Priority Recommendation 🧱 Upgrades Route Expansion → Fleet Management → Lounge Perks 👥 Staff Roles Pilots, Flight Crew, HR, Logistics 🛫 Focus Perks Travel time reduction, energy regen, revenue

docs.title: 🎁 Perks Breakdown
docs.text: Perk Effect Unlocks at 🕒 Travel Time Reduction Cuts travel time by 10–25% Mid- to high upgrades ⚡ Energy Boost (minor) +1–2 energy daily Loyalty + upgrades 💼 Faction Travel Perks Shared benefits for faction members Requires coordination

docs.title: 📈 Tips for Success
docs.text:
• Best run with faction support—benefits scale with group use
  • Requires active management of routes and staff
  • Can be a prestige symbol and perk engine in one
  • Not ideal for solo players or low-activity accounts

docs.title: 🙋 Who Should Run This
docs.text:
✅ Faction leaders or travel-heavy mains ✅ Players with time and capital to manage complexity ✅ Those seeking prestige and shared perks ❌ Avoid if you want low-maintenance or solo play

➡️ 📺 Try TV Station instead ➡️ 🏠 Back to Start or Buy

docs.title: Rec farm
docs.text: ⬅️ Back to Budget: $100m – $500m

docs.title: 🌾 Farm
docs.text:
Underrated powerhouse for passive profit and stat synergy

The Farm isn't flashy—but don’t let that fool you. It’s flexible, surprisingly profitable, and opens up perks for energy, happiness, and even strength. A hidden gem for anyone seeking a hands-off income stream with benefits.

docs.title: 🧠 Requirements
docs.text:
• Recommended INT: 300+
  • Staff: 6–12
  • Setup Cost: ~$160M–$220M
  • Upkeep: Low to moderate

docs.title: 🧰 Suggested Setup
docs.text: Priority Recommendation 🧱 Upgrades Storage → Staff Capacity → Greenhouse 👥 Staff Roles Farmers, HR, Sales 🌿 Focus Perks Energy boosts, happiness, strength accessory

docs.title: 🎁 Perks Breakdown
docs.text: Perk Effect Unlocks at ⚡ Energy Boost Small +1–2 energy per day Mid upgrades 😄 Happiness Bonus 50–100+ daily (good for rehab synergy) High staff loyalty 💪 Strength Accessory +% STR perk with certain hires Needs specific roles

docs.title: 📈 Tips for Success
docs.text:
• Ideal for players with multiple accounts or part-time play
  • Perks stack nicely with donator and faction bonuses
  • Use as a perk-farm: don’t expect huge daily cashflow
  • Can be a chill stepping stone before premium companies

docs.title: 🙋 Who Should Run This
docs.text:
✅ Hands-off strategists ✅ Players chasing happiness, energy, and passive bonuses ✅ Alts, medics, or strength-training mains ❌ Not for high-maintenance or money-maxed builds

➡️ 🕹️ Try Game Dev instead ➡️ 🏠 Back to Start or Buy

docs.title: Rec game development
docs.text: ⬅️ Back to Budget: $100m – $500m

docs.title: 🕹️ Game Development
docs.text:
Tech-savvy profits with scalable power and prestige

The Game Development company is a fan-favorite for good reason: mid-setup cost, potent perks, and great synergy with INT-heavy builds. Its income is solid and its upgrade curve rewards smart planning.

docs.title: 🧠 Requirements
docs.text:
• Recommended INT: 400+
  • Staff: 5–15
  • Setup Cost: ~$200M–$350M
  • Upkeep: Moderate to high at scale

docs.title: 🧰 Suggested Setup
docs.text: Priority Recommendation 🧱 Upgrades Capacity → Office Space → QA/UX Tuning 👥 Staff Roles Programmers, QA, Designers, Manual HR 🎯 Focus Perks Crime XP bonus, passive daily money

docs.title: 🎁 Perks Breakdown
docs.text: Perk Effect Unlocks at 🕵️ Crime XP Boost +5–10% crime XP 8+ staff, level 4+ 💵 Steady Cash Flow Reliable mid-range daily income All tiers 🧠 Productivity Bonus Improves INT job benefits Higher upgrades

docs.title: 📈 Tips for Success
docs.text:
• Staff loyalty boosts perks—aim for long-term hires
  • High synergy with Nerve training and crime-based builds
  • Competitive scaling: can outperform premium companies with focus
  • Consider hiring from within your faction to boost morale fast

docs.title: 🙋 Who Should Run This
docs.text:
✅ INT-focused players ✅ Passive earners with moderate upkeep tolerance ✅ Faction crime strategists ❌ Avoid if low INT or minimal time to manage staff

➡️ 🔧 Try Mechanic instead ➡️ 🏠 Back to Start or Buy

docs.title: Rec mechanic
docs.text: ⬅️ Back to Budget: $100m – $500m

docs.title: 🔧 Mechanic
docs.text:
Torque, tools, and STR perks on overdrive

Mechanic companies are a player favorite thanks to their straightforward scaling, strong synergy with STR training, and consistent income. It’s the garage that prints money and gains muscle—without needing premium bells and whistles.

docs.title: 🧠 Requirements
docs.text:
• Recommended INT: 250+
  • Staff: 6–12
  • Setup Cost: ~$180M–$280M
  • Upkeep: Moderate

docs.title: 🧰 Suggested Setup
docs.text: Priority Recommendation 🧱 Upgrades Capacity → Quality Tools → STR Modifiers 👥 Staff Roles Mechanics (manual), Sales, Manager 🔩 Focus Perks STR boost, faster gym cooldowns

docs.title: 🎁 Perks Breakdown
docs.text: Perk Effect Unlocks at 💪 Strength Boost +2%–5% STR gain Staff loyalty + upgrades 🕒 Gym Cooldown Cut Slight cooldown reduction Mid-tier level 💸 Consistent Revenue Great for cashflow, STR-focused teams Any staffed level

docs.title: 📈 Tips for Success
docs.text:
• Ideal pick for strength-based players
  • STR boost perks apply even when you're not logged in
  • Keep 2–3 mechanics onboard full time for maximum scaling
  • Great value for newer factions focused on gym gains

docs.title: 🙋 Who Should Run This
docs.text:
✅ STR-focused mains or alts ✅ Semi-active players with gym goals ✅ Factions needing strength perks ❌ Not optimal for INT builds or item generation

➡️ 🌾 Try Farm instead ➡️ 🏠 Back to Start or Buy

docs.title: Rec music store
docs.text: ⬅️ Back to Budget: Under $100m

docs.title: 🎶 Music Store
docs.text:
Your Passive-Earning, Bonus-Dropping Side Hustle

The Music Store thrives on minimal oversight. It's like an indie band with a cult following—quietly profitable, rarely demanding, and surprisingly cool to manage.

docs.title: 🧠 Requirements
docs.text:
• Recommended INT: 100+ for optimal drop frequency
  • Staff: 2–5 ideal (Sales Reps, Manual, or HR mix)
  • Setup Cost: ~$60M–$80M
  • Upkeep: Low to moderate (depends on staff fill rate)

docs.title: 🧰 Suggested Setup
docs.text: Priority Recommendation 🧱 Upgrades Level 1 → Staff Capacity → Item Quality 👥 Staff Roles Sales Reps + Manual for speed 💽 Focus Perks Bonus items, passive income

docs.title: 🎁 Perks Breakdown
docs.text: Perk Effect Unlocks at 🎁 Bonus Item Drops Random item drops from daily activity Level 3+ with 4 staff 💰 Increased Revenue Boost to daily passive income Mid-tier upgrades 🎫 Coupon Generation Potential future perk (depends on meta) Not guaranteed

docs.title: 📈 Tips for Success
docs.text:
• Fill staff early—bonuses scale with activity
  • Use job ads or faction posts to fill fast
  • Combine with faction job perks for optimal profit
  • Low stress even with 0 daily input

docs.title: 🙋 Who Should Run This
docs.text:
✅ Casual or alt accounts ✅ Bonus hunters ✅ Faction support players ❌ Not built for stat gains or fast cash grabs

➡️ 🍝 Try Restaurant instead ➡️ 🏠 Back to Start or Buy

docs.title: Rec restaurant
docs.text: ⬅️ Back to Budget: Under $100m

docs.title: 🍝 Restaurant
docs.text:
Your Strength-Boosting, Money-Making Bistro Boss Build

The Restaurant is a hybrid gem—solid profits, STR training perks, and a familiar layout that scales beautifully with a bit of love and salt.

docs.title: 🧠 Requirements
docs.text:
• Recommended INT: 300+ (for perk scaling)
  • Staff: 5–10 for solid progression
  • Setup Cost: ~$80M–$100M
  • Upkeep: Moderate (as staff grows)

docs.title: 🧰 Suggested Setup
docs.text: Priority Recommendation 🧱 Upgrades Capacity → Staff Quality → Stat Bonus Tier 👥 Staff Roles Sales Reps, Manual Workers, HR 🍖 Focus Perks Strength boost, staff productivity

docs.title: 🎁 Perks Breakdown
docs.text: Perk Effect Unlocks at 🥩 Strength Boost Gym strength +2%–5% Varies w/ upgrades 🍷 Energy w/ Meals Minimal energy regen (thematic) Mid-tier upgrades 🍽️ Bonus Dining Exp Flavor only (no actual effect) Early tier

docs.title: 📈 Tips for Success
docs.text:
• Perfect entry point if you want to mix passive money with stat training
  • Consider hiring faction members for fast loyalty
  • Great launchpad into higher-tier companies later

docs.title: 🙋 Who Should Run This
docs.text:
✅ Hybrid players (stats + money) ✅ Mid-budget builders ✅ New faction leaders testing staff perks ❌ Not ideal for INT training or ultra-low upkeep

➡️ 🎶 Try Music Store instead ➡️ 🏠 Back to Start or Buy

docs.title: Rec software corp
docs.text: ⬅️ Back to Budget: $500m+

docs.title: 💻 Software Corporation
docs.text:
Elite INT scaling and passive perks for masterminds

The Software Corp is Torn’s answer to “What if intelligence = income?” It demands serious upfront investment but rewards you with some of the most useful passive bonuses in the game—ideal for mains or alts stacked with smarts.

docs.title: 🧠 Requirements
docs.text:
• Recommended INT: 700+
  • Staff: 15–25
  • Setup Cost: ~$600M–$850M
  • Upkeep: High (especially with full hiring)

docs.title: 🧰 Suggested Setup
docs.text: Priority Recommendation 🧱 Upgrades Processor Tier → Algorithmic QA → Innovation 👥 Staff Roles Developers, HR, Lead Architects 🎯 Focus Perks Passive income, energy, reduced cooldown

docs.title: 🎁 Perks Breakdown
docs.text: Perk Effect Unlocks at ⚡ Energy Regen Slight bonus to daily regen Mid- to late upgrades 🧠 INT Boost (Minor) Bonus to INT job outputs Loyalty + team synergy 🕒 Item Cooldown Reduction Speeds up consumables by a few % High-tier upgrades

docs.title: 📈 Tips for Success
docs.text:
• Strong passive profits—if staff loyalty stays high
  • Perks scale better when everyone is INT-heavy
  • Use this to complement crimes, hacking, or investments
  • Software Corp is one of the few companies that improves you, not just your wallet

docs.title: 🙋 Who Should Run This
docs.text:
✅ INT mains or hacker-style builds ✅ Players who want daily bonuses without logging in ✅ Long-term efficiency fanatics ❌ Avoid if STR/DEX-based or don’t love staff management

➡️ ✈️ Try Airline instead ➡️ 🏠 Back to Start or Buy

docs.title: Rec sweet shop
docs.text: ⬅️ Back to Budget: Under $100m

docs.title: 🍬 Sweet Shop
docs.text:
Your Low-Budget, Passive Profit Companion

The Sweet Shop is ideal for solo players or those new to company management. It’s cost-effective, easy to run, and still delivers reliable passive perks.

docs.title: 🧠 Requirements
docs.text:
• Recommended INT: 0+ (great for beginners)
  • Staff: 1–3 (solo-friendly)
  • Upkeep: Very low
  • Setup Cost: ~$40M–$60M

docs.title: 🧰 Suggested Setup
docs.text: Priority Recommendation 🧱 Upgrades Level 1 → Storage → Staff Cap 👥 Staff Roles Director + 1–2 Sales Reps 🎯 Focus Perks Item cooldown, candy drops, energy

docs.title: 🎁 Perks Breakdown
docs.text: Perk Effect Unlocks at 🍬 Candy Drop Occasional candy item drops 3+ staff, Level 3 🕒 Item Cooldown Boost Slight reduction in cooldown timers After Storage Upgrade ⚡ Basic Energy Boost +1 Energy daily (minimal impact) Later upgrades

docs.title: 📈 Tips for Success
docs.text:
• Focus early on Storage to unlock staff slots
  • Don’t chase every perk—scale sustainably
  • Perfect for alt accounts or players with limited time

docs.title: 🙋 Who Should Run This
docs.text:
✅ Solo players ✅ Passive income lovers ✅ Low-maintenance strategy ❌ Not for stat training or max profits

➡️ 🏗️ Explore $100m–$500m Options ➡️ 🏠 Return to Start or Buy

docs.title: Rec tv station
docs.text: ⬅️ Back to Budget: $500m+

docs.title: 📺 TV Station
docs.text:
Where money flows, crimes glow, and power shows

The TV Station is Torn’s big-budget flagship. It’s flashy, highly customizable, and potentially overwhelming—until you realize it prints money, perks, and criminal XP at a staggering pace.

docs.title: 🧠 Requirements
docs.text:
• Recommended INT: 600+ (scales better with 800+)
  • Staff: 15–30
  • Setup Cost: ~$700M–$1B
  • Upkeep: High (but worth it if managed)

docs.title: 🧰 Suggested Setup
docs.text: Priority Recommendation 🧱 Upgrades Broadcast Quality → Crime Department → PR 👥 Staff Roles Journalists, HR, Managers, Anchors 🎯 Focus Perks Crime XP, media influence, energy regen

docs.title: 🎁 Perks Breakdown
docs.text: Perk Effect Unlocks at 🕵️ Crime XP Bonus Huge XP gains from crimes Level 4+, 20+ staff ⚡ Energy Regen Boost Slight bonus to daily regen (stackable) Mid-tier, loyalty based 📰 News Feature Perk Roleplay potential, minor influence Cosmetic/perk crossover

docs.title: 📈 Tips for Success
docs.text:
• Needs high loyalty staff for best bonuses
  • Coordinate perks with faction crime strategies
  • Hiring active journalists can unlock speed scaling
  • Big setup—don’t bite unless you’re fully committed

docs.title: 🙋 Who Should Run This
docs.text:
✅ Crime-heavy mains ✅ Faction strategists ✅ Big spenders who want showstopping perks ❌ Not for casual or alt playstyles

➡️ 💻 Try Software Corporation ➡️ 🏠 Back to Start or Buy
